alert.note: Alert for Coleman; Concho; McCulloch; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 9:03PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Coleman, northwestern McCulloch, southeastern Runnels and northeastern Concho Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 902 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Leaday, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coleman, Gouldbusk, Rockwood, Doole, Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina, Voss, Stacy, Waldrip, Valera, Leaday, Millersview, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1929 And Ranch Road 2134, Fife, Mozelle, Us-283 Near The Mcculloch- Coleman County Line, Whon, Fisk and Shields. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
